title.raw: 《孝武本紀》 Annals of the Xiaowu Emperor

sentences.zh: 孝武皇帝者，孝景中子也。

translations.literal: Emperor Xiaowu was Emperor Xiaojing's middle son.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Xiaowu was the middle son of Emperor Xiaojing.

sentences.zh: 母曰王太后。

translations.literal: Mother called Empress Dowager Wang.
translations.idiomatic: His mother was Empress Dowager Wang.

sentences.zh: 孝景四年，以皇子為膠東王。

translations.literal: Xiaojing fourth year, made imperial son King of Jiaodong.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Emperor Xiaojing's reign, he was made King of Jiaodong as an imperial prince.

sentences.zh: 孝景七年，栗太子廢為臨江王，以膠東王為太子。

translations.literal: Xiaojing seventh year, Crown Prince Li deposed to become the King of Linjiang, King of Jiaodong made crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year of Emperor Xiaojing's reign, Crown Prince Li was deposed and made King of Linjiang, while the King of Jiaodong was made crown prince.

sentences.zh: 孝景十六年崩，太子即位，為孝武皇帝。

translations.literal: The Xiaojing sixteenth year collapsed, crown prince ascended throne as Emperor Xiaowu.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year of Emperor Xiaojing's reign, he passed away, and the crown prince ascended the throne as Emperor Xiaowu.

sentences.zh: 孝武皇帝初即位，尤敬鬼神之祀。

translations.literal: Emperor Xiaowu first ascended throne, especially revered ghosts spirits sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Xiaowu first ascended the throne, he showed particular reverence for sacrifices to ghosts and spirits.

translations.literal: Emperor Xiaowu was Emperor Xiaojing's middle son. His mother was called Empress Dowager Wang. In Emperor Xiaojing's fourth year, he was made King of Jiaodong as an imperial son. In Emperor Xiaojing's seventh year, Crown Prince Li was deposed to become King of Linjiang, and the King of Jiaodong was made Crown Prince. Emperor Xiaojing collapsed in the sixteenth year. The Crown Prince ascended the throne and became Emperor Xiaowu. When Emperor Xiaowu first ascended the throne, he especially respected the sacrifices to ghosts and spirits.

sentences.zh: 元年，漢興已六十餘歲矣，天下乂安，薦紳之屬皆望天子封禪改正度也。

translations.literal: First year, Han arisen already sixty remaining years, all under Heaven peaceful secure, the scholars officials all hoped Son of Heaven would perform Feng Shan sacrifices reform calendar measurements.
translations.idiomatic: In his first year, more than sixty years had passed since the founding of the Han dynasty. The realm was peaceful and secure, and scholars and officials all hoped that the Son of Heaven would perform the Feng and Shan sacrifices and reform the calendar and measurements.

sentences.zh: 而上鄉儒術，招賢良，趙綰、王臧等以文學為公卿，欲議古立明堂城南，以朝諸侯。

translations.literal: And emperor favored Confucian learning, recruited worthy good men, Zhao Wan, Wang Zang etc. through literature became high ministers, wished to discuss antiquity establish Mingtang south of capital to receive the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor favored Confucian learning and recruited worthy men. Zhao Wan, Wang Zang, and others rose to become high ministers through their literary accomplishments. He wished to discuss the ancient ways and establish a Mingtang hall south of the capital to receive the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 草巡狩封禪改歷服色事未就。

translations.literal: Planned imperial tours Feng Shan sacrifices change calendar clothing colors matters not completed.
translations.idiomatic: Plans for imperial tours, Feng and Shan sacrifices, calendar reform, and changes to clothing and colors had not yet been completed.

sentences.zh: 會竇太后治黃老言，不好儒術，使人微得趙綰等姦利事，召案綰、臧，綰、臧自殺，諸所興為者皆廢。

translations.literal: Happened the Empress Dowager Dou practiced Huang-Lao teachings disliked Confucian learning, sent people secretly obtained Zhao Wan etc. corrupt profiteering matters, summoned investigated Wan Zang, Wan Zang committed suicide, all initiated things abolished.
translations.idiomatic: Just then, Empress Dowager Dou practiced the teachings of Huang-Lao and disliked Confucian learning. She sent people to secretly uncover corrupt dealings by Zhao Wan and others. They were summoned and investigated; Wan and Zang committed suicide. All the initiatives they had begun were abolished.

translations.literal: In the first year, the Han had risen already over sixty years. The realm was pacified and peaceful. All the scholar-officials hoped the Son of Heaven would perform the fengshan ceremony and correct the calendar measures. The emperor favored Confucian arts and recruited the worthy and good. Zhao Wan, Wang Zang, and others became ministers through literature. They wished to discuss the ancient practice of establishing a Bright Hall south of the city to receive the feudal lords. The matters of drafting imperial tours, fengshan ceremonies, changing the calendar, and clothing colors were not completed. Empress Dowager Dou governed with Huang-Lao teachings and did not like Confucian arts. She had someone secretly obtain evidence of Zhao Wan and others' illicit profits, summoned and investigated Wan and Zang. Wan and Zang committed suicide. All the things they had promoted were abolished.

sentences.zh: 後六年，竇太后崩。

translations.literal: After six years, Empress Dowager Dou collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: Six years later, Empress Dowager Dou passed away.

sentences.zh: 其明年，上徵文學之士公孫弘等。

translations.literal: Next year, emperor summoned literary scholars Gongsun Hong etc.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, the emperor summoned literary scholars such as Gongsun Hong.

translations.literal: After six years, Empress Dowager Dou collapsed. The next year, the emperor summoned scholars of literature like Gongsun Hong.

sentences.zh: 明年，上初至雍，郊見五畤。

translations.literal: Next year, emperor first went to Yong, performed suburban sacrifice to Five Altar sites.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, the emperor first went to Yong and performed suburban sacrifices to the Five Altar sites.

sentences.zh: 後常三歲一郊。

translations.literal: Afterwards regularly three years one suburban sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: Thereafter, he regularly performed suburban sacrifices once every three years.

sentences.zh: 是時上求神君，捨之上林中蹄氏觀。

translations.literal: This time emperor sought Divine Lord, housed him in the Tiji Pavilion in Shanglin Park.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the emperor sought the Divine Lord and housed him in the Tiji Pavilion within Shanglin Park.

sentences.zh: 神君者，長陵女子，以子死悲哀，故見神於先後宛若。

translations.literal: Divine Lord was Changling woman, because child died grieved, therefore appeared as spirit to husband Yanruo.
translations.idiomatic: The Divine Lord was a woman from Changling who, grieving over her dead child, appeared as a spirit to her husband Yanruo.

sentences.zh: 宛若祠之其室，民多往祠。

translations.literal: Yanruo sacrificed to her in his chamber, people often went to sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: Yanruo sacrificed to her in his chamber, and many people came to make offerings.

sentences.zh: 平原君往祠，其後子孫以尊顯。

translations.literal: Lord of Pingyuan went to sacrifice, afterwards descendants became honored eminent.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Pingyuan went to make offerings, and thereafter his descendants became honored and eminent.

sentences.zh: 及武帝即位，則厚禮置祠之內中，聞其言，不見其人云。

translations.literal: When Emperor Wu ascended throne, then treated with great ceremony placed shrine in inner palace, heard her words, did not see her person, it is said.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Wu ascended the throne, he treated her with great ceremony and placed her shrine in the inner palace. Her words could be heard, but her person was never seen, so it was said.

translations.literal: The next year, the emperor first arrived at Yong and performed suburban audience at the five altars. Afterwards, he regularly performed suburban sacrifices every three years. At this time, the emperor sought the divine lord and lodged at the Ti clan observation in the middle of Shanglin. The divine lord was a woman from Changling. Because her son died and she was sorrowful, she therefore saw a spirit that resembled her deceased husband Wan Ruo. Wan Ruo sacrificed to her in her room. Many people went to sacrifice there. The Lord of Pingyuan went to sacrifice there. His later descendants became honored and illustrious. When Emperor Wu ascended the throne, he then placed her with thick ritual in the inner palace for sacrifice. One heard her words but did not see her person, it is said.

sentences.zh: 是時而李少君亦以祠灶、穀道、卻老方見上，上尊之。

translations.literal: This time Li Shaojun also with stove sacrifice, grain immortality, ward off old age methods appeared before emperor, emperor honored him.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Li Shaojun also appeared before the emperor with methods for sacrificing to the stove, grain immortality, and warding off old age, and the emperor honored him.

sentences.zh: 少君者，故深澤侯入以主方。

translations.literal: Shaojun was former Marquis of Shenze's son who entered as master of recipes.
translations.idiomatic: Shaojun was the son of the former Marquis of Shenze who entered court as a master of recipes.

sentences.zh: 匿其年及所生長，常自謂七十，能使物，卻老。

translations.literal: Concealed his age and birthplace, constantly claimed seventy, could manipulate things, ward off old age.
translations.idiomatic: He concealed his age and birthplace, constantly claiming to be seventy. He could manipulate things and ward off the old age.

sentences.zh: 其游以方遍諸侯。

translations.literal: His travels with recipes went throughout feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: His travels with his recipes took him throughout the domains of the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 無妻子。

translations.literal: Had no wife children.
translations.idiomatic: He had neither wife nor children.

sentences.zh: 人聞其能使物及不死，更饋遺之，常餘金錢帛衣食。

translations.literal: People heard his ability to manipulate things and immortality, moreover gave him gifts, constantly had surplus gold money silk clothing food.
translations.idiomatic: People heard of the ability to manipulate things and achieve immortality, and moreover gave him gifts. He constantly had surplus gold, money, silk, clothing, and food.

sentences.zh: 人皆以為不治產業而饒給，又不知其何所人，愈信，爭事之。

translations.literal: People all thought did not manage property but wealthy, moreover did not know where income came from, became even more believing, competed to serve him.
translations.idiomatic: Everyone thought that he did not manage any property yet was wealthy, and moreover did not know where the income came from. They became even more believing and competed to serve him.

sentences.zh: 少君資好方，善為巧發奇中。

translations.literal: Shaojun had natural talent for recipes, skilled at making clever discoveries miraculously hit mark.
translations.idiomatic: Shaojun had a natural talent for recipes and was skilled at making clever discoveries that miraculously hit their mark.

sentences.zh: 嘗從武安侯飲，坐中有年九十餘老人，少君乃言與其大父游射處，老人為兒時從其大父行，識其處，一坐盡驚。

translations.literal: Once followed Marquis of Wuan drinking, seats had old man ninety remaining years, Shaojun then spoke of places roamed hunted with his grandfather, old man as child followed his grandfather went, recognized places, whole gathering completely astonished.
translations.idiomatic: Once when he was drinking with the Marquis of Wuan, there was an old man of more than ninety years among the guests. Shaojun spoke of places where he had roamed and hunted with the old man's grandfather. The old man, recalling how he had followed his grandfather as a child, recognized the places. The entire gathering was completely astonished.

sentences.zh: 少君見上，上有故銅器，問少君。

translations.literal: Shaojun appeared before emperor, emperor had old bronze vessel, asked Shaojun.
translations.idiomatic: Shaojun appeared before the emperor, who had an old bronze vessel and asked Shaojun about it.

sentences.zh: 少君曰：「此器齊桓公十年陳於柏寢。」

translations.literal: Shaojun said: "This vessel Duke Huan of Qi tenth year displayed in Cypress Chamber."
translations.idiomatic: Shaojun said: 'This vessel was displayed in the Cypress Chamber by Duke Huan of Qi in his tenth year.'

sentences.zh: 已而案其刻，果齊桓公器。

translations.literal: Afterwards examined its inscriptions, indeed Duke Huan of Qi's vessel.
translations.idiomatic: Afterward, when he examined the inscriptions, it was indeed a vessel of Duke Huan of Qi.

sentences.zh: 一宮盡駭，以少君為神，數百歲人也。

translations.literal: Whole palace completely astonished, took Shaojun as god, several hundred years person.
translations.idiomatic: The entire palace was completely astonished and took Shaojun to be a god, a person several hundred years old.

translations.literal: At this time, Li Shaogun also appeared before the emperor with methods of sacrificing to the stove, grain immortality, and dispelling old age. The emperor honored him. Shaogun was a person from the former Marquis of Shenze who came with the main methods. He concealed his age and where he grew up. He often claimed to be seventy, able to make things happen and dispel old age. His travels with methods reached everywhere among the feudal lords. He had no wife or children. People heard of his ability to make things happen and achieve immortality. They moreover fed and sent him gifts, often leaving surplus gold, money, silks, clothing, and food. People all considered that he did not manage estates yet had abundant supply, and moreover did not know where his income came from. They believed even more and contended to serve him. Shaogun was naturally good at methods and skilled at clever revelations that marveled and hit the mark. Once he followed the Marquis of Wuan drinking. In the seats there was an old man over ninety years. Shaogun then spoke of places where he had toured and shot with his grandfather. The old man, when he was a child, had followed his grandfather and gone there, and recognized those places. The entire gathering was astonished. Shaogun saw the emperor. The emperor had an old bronze vessel and asked Shaogun about it. Shaogun said: 'This vessel was displayed by Duke Huan of Qi in his tenth year at the Bo resting place.' Then they examined its inscriptions, and indeed it was a vessel of Duke Huan of Qi. The whole palace was startled, took Shaojun as a spirit, a several hundred years person also.

sentences.zh: 少君言於上曰：「祠灶則致物，致物而丹沙可化為黃金，黃金成以為飲食器則益壽，益壽而海中蓬萊僊者可見，見之以封禪則不死，黃帝是也。

translations.literal: Shaojun spoke to emperor saying: "Sacrifice to stove then brings things, bringing things then cinnabar sand can transform into gold, gold completed make eating drinking vessels then increases longevity, increases longevity then sea Penglai immortals can be seen, see them perform Feng Shan then immortality, Yellow Emperor is example.
translations.idiomatic: Shaojun spoke to the emperor, saying: 'Sacrifice to the stove and it will bring things. When things are brought, cinnabar and sand can be transformed into gold. When gold is completed and made into eating and drinking vessels, it increases longevity. When longevity is increased, the immortals of Penglai in the sea can be seen. When you see them and perform the Feng and Shan sacrifices, you achieve immortality. The Yellow Emperor is an example.'

sentences.zh: 臣嘗游海上，見安期生，食臣棗，大如瓜。

translations.literal: I once traveled sea, saw An Qisheng, fed me dates large as melons.
translations.idiomatic: I once traveled across the sea and saw An Qisheng, who fed me dates as large as melons.

sentences.zh: 安期生僊者，通蓬萊中，合則見人，不合則隱。」

translations.literal: An Qisheng immortal, communicates Penglai, accords then appears to people, not accords then hides."
translations.idiomatic: An Qisheng is an immortal who communicates with Penglai. When conditions accord, he appears to people; when they do not, he hides.'

sentences.zh: 於是天子始親祠灶，而遣方士入海求蓬萊安期生之屬，而事化丹沙諸藥齊為黃金矣。

translations.literal: Thereupon Son of Heaven began personally sacrificing to stove, dispatched alchemists into sea seek Penglai An Qisheng and like, undertook transforming cinnabar various medicines into gold.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the Son of Heaven began personally sacrificing to the stove, and dispatched alchemists into the sea to seek Penglai and those like An Qisheng, while undertaking the transformation of cinnabar, various medicines, and other substances into gold.

translations.literal: Shaojun spoke to the emperor said: 'Sacrifice stove then bring things. Bring things and cinnabar sand can transform into yellow gold. Yellow gold completed as food and drink vessels then increase longevity. Increase longevity and sea middle Penglai immortals can be seen. Seen with feng shan then not die. Yellow Emperor is this.' Minister once toured above the sea, saw An Qisheng, fed minister dates, big as melon. An Qisheng is an immortal person, connects to Penglai middle, when harmonious then sees people, when not harmonious then hides.' Thereupon the Son of Heaven began personally sacrificing to the stove, yet sent fangshi who entered the sea and sought Penglai and An Qisheng's kind, yet undertook transforming cinnabar sand and various medicines together into yellow gold.

sentences.zh: 居久之，李少君病死。

translations.literal: After long time, Li Shaojun fell ill died.
translations.idiomatic: After a long time, Li Shaojun fell ill and died.

sentences.zh: 天子以為化去不死也，而使黃錘史寬舒受其方。

translations.literal: Emperor thought transformed gone immortal, sent Huang Chuoshi Kuanshu receive his recipes.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor thought he had transformed and gone away to immortality, and sent Huang Chuoshi Kuanshu to receive his recipes.

sentences.zh: 求蓬萊安期生莫能得，而海上燕齊怪迂之方士多相效，更言神事矣。

translations.literal: Seeking Penglai An Qisheng could not obtain, coastal Yan Qi strange impractical alchemists many imitated each other, moreover spoke divine matters.
translations.idiomatic: They sought Penglai and An Qisheng but could not obtain them, while many strange and impractical alchemists along the Yan and Qi coasts imitated each other and moreover spoke of divine matters.

translations.literal: Stayed a long time, Li Shaojun illness died. The Son of Heaven considered that he had transformed and departed, achieving immortality. He made the Huangchui Scribe Kuanshu receive his methods. He sought Penglai and An Qisheng but none could be obtained. Yet the coastal Yan and Qi strange and far-fetched method masters mostly imitated each other, moreover speaking of divine matters.

sentences.zh: 亳人薄誘忌奏祠泰一方，曰：「天神貴者泰一，泰一佐曰五帝。

translations.literal: Man from Bo, Bo Youji memorialized sacrifice to Taiyi method, said: "Heavenly deity most honored Taiyi, Taiyi assistants called Five Emperors.
translations.idiomatic: A man from Bo named Bo Youji memorialized a method for sacrificing to Taiyi, saying: 'The most honored heavenly deity is Taiyi, and Taiyi's assistants are called the Five Emperors.

sentences.zh: 古者天子以春秋祭泰一東南郊，用太牢具，七日，為壇開八通之鬼道。」

translations.literal: Anciently Son of Heaven in spring autumn sacrificed Taiyi southeastern suburbs, used great sacrificial animals, seven days, made altar opened eight paths ghosts."
translations.idiomatic: Anciently the Son of Heaven sacrificed to Taiyi in the southeastern suburbs during spring and autumn, using great sacrificial animals for seven days, making an altar and opening eight paths for the ghosts.'

sentences.zh: 於是天子令太祝立其祠長安東南郊，常奉祠如忌方。

translations.literal: Thereupon Son of Heaven ordered Grand Invocator establish shrine Chang'an southeastern suburbs, regularly performed sacrifices like Youji's method.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the Son of Heaven ordered the Grand Invocator to establish the shrine in the southeastern suburbs of Chang'an, and regularly performed sacrifices according to Youji's method.

sentences.zh: 其後人有上書，言「古者天子三年一用太牢具祠神三一：天一，地一，泰一」。

translations.literal: Afterwards someone submitted memorial, said "Anciently Son of Heaven three years once used great sacrificial animals sacrificed three supreme ones: Tianyi, Diyi, Taiyi."
translations.idiomatic: Afterward, someone submitted a memorial saying, 'Anciently the Son of Heaven once every three years used great sacrificial animals to sacrifice to the three supreme ones: Tianyi, Diyi, and Taiyi.'

sentences.zh: 天子許之，令太祝領祠之忌泰一壇上，如其方。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven approved it, ordered Grand Invocator lead sacrifices to them on Youji's Taiyi altar, according to that method.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven approved it and ordered the Grand Invocator to lead sacrifices to them on Youji's Taiyi altar, according to that method.

sentences.zh: 後人復有上書，言「古者天子常以春秋解祠，祠黃帝用一梟破鏡；

translations.literal: Later someone else submitted memorial, said "Anciently Son of Heaven regularly in spring autumn performed exorcism sacrifice, sacrificed Yellow Emperor used one owl broken mirror;
translations.idiomatic: Later someone else submitted a memorial saying, 'Anciently the Son of Heaven regularly performed exorcism sacrifices in spring and autumn, and when sacrificing to the Yellow Emperor used one owl and a broken mirror;

sentences.zh: 冥羊用羊；

translations.literal: Dark Sheep uses sheep;
translations.idiomatic: The Dark Sheep uses a sheep.

sentences.zh: 祠馬行用一青牡馬；

translations.literal: Sacrificing Horse Way uses one blue stallion;
translations.idiomatic: The Sacrificing Horse Way uses one blue stallion.

sentences.zh: 泰一、皋山山君、地長用牛；

translations.literal: Taiyi, Gaoshan Mountain Lord, Earth Elder use oxen;
translations.idiomatic: Taiyi, the Gaoshan Mountain Lord, and the Earth Elder use oxen;

sentences.zh: 武夷君用乾魚；

translations.literal: Wuyi Lord uses dried fish;
translations.idiomatic: The Wuyi Lord uses dried fish.

sentences.zh: 陰陽使者以一牛」。

translations.literal: Yin Yang messengers with one ox."
translations.idiomatic: The Yin Yang messengers use one ox.'

sentences.zh: 令祠官領之如其方，而祠於忌泰一壇旁。

translations.literal: Ordered sacrificial officials lead them like that method, sacrificed beside Youji's Taiyi altar.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered the sacrificial officials to lead them according to that method, and sacrificed beside Youji's Taiyi altar.

translations.literal: The Bo person Bo Youji memorialized a method for sacrificing to Taiyi, saying: 'Among heaven's spirits, the noble one is Taiyi. Taiyi's assistants are called the Five Emperors.' The ancient Son of Heaven sacrificed to Taiyi in the southeast suburbs during spring and autumn, using complete great sacrificial animals, for seven days, making an altar that opened the eight directions for the ghost paths.' Thereupon the Son of Heaven commanded the Grand Invocator to establish his sacrifice in the southeast suburbs of Chang'an, constantly conducting the sacrifice according to Youji's method. Afterward, someone memorialized a book saying: 'The ancient Son of Heaven once every three years used complete great sacrificial animals to sacrifice to the three spirits: Heaven One, Earth One, Taiyi One.' The Son of Heaven permitted it and commanded the Grand Invocator to lead the sacrifice above Youji's Taiyi altar, according to his method. Later people again had submit memorial, spoke 'Ancient ones Son of Heaven often with spring autumn solved sacrifices, sacrificed Yellow Emperor used one xiao broken mirror; Mingyang used sheep; Sacrificed Maxing used one blue stallion; Taiyi, Gaoshan mountain lord, earth long used cattle; The Lord of Wuyi used dried fish; The yin yang envoys used one ox.' He commanded the sacrifice officials to lead it according to his method, and sacrifice at the side of Youji's Taiyi altar.

sentences.zh: 其後，天子苑有白鹿，以其皮為幣，以發瑞應，造白金焉。

translations.literal: Afterwards, emperor's park had white deer, used its hide for currency, to issue auspicious responses, made white gold.
translations.idiomatic: Afterward, the emperor's park had a white deer, and its hide was used for currency to issue auspicious responses, and white gold was made.

translations.literal: Afterward, the Son of Heaven's park had a white deer. He made currency from its hide to issue auspicious responses, and made white gold there.

sentences.zh: 其明年，郊雍，獲一角獸，若麃然。

translations.literal: Next year, performed suburban sacrifice at Yong, obtained one-horned beast, like muntjac.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, when performing the suburban sacrifice at Yong, they obtained a one-horned beast, like a muntjac.

sentences.zh: 有司曰：「陛下肅祗郊祀，上帝報享，錫一角獸，蓋麟云。」

translations.literal: Officials said: "Your Majesty reverently performed suburban sacrifice, Supreme Deity responded with favor, bestowed one-horned beast, probably qilin."
translations.idiomatic: The officials said: 'Your Majesty reverently performed the suburban sacrifice, the Supreme Deity responded with favor, and bestowed a one-horned beast, probably a qilin.'

sentences.zh: 於是以薦五畤，畤加一牛以燎。

translations.literal: Thereupon presented to Five Altars, each altar added one ox for burnt offering.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon they presented offerings to the Five Altars, and each altar added one ox for the burnt offering.

sentences.zh: 賜諸侯白金，以風符應合于天地。

translations.literal: Granted white gold to feudal lords, to demonstrate tally corresponded harmonized with Heaven Earth.
translations.idiomatic: White gold was granted to the feudal lords to demonstrate that the tally corresponded and harmonized with Heaven and Earth.

translations.literal: The next year, at the suburban sacrifice in Yong, they obtained a one-horned beast, like a mi deer. The officials said: 'Your Majesty solemnly and respectfully performed the suburban sacrifice. The Supreme Deity responded and enjoyed it, bestowing a one-horned beast - probably a qilin.' Thereupon they offered it to the five altars, with each altar adding one ox for burning. He granted the feudal lords white gold, to make the talismans respond and unite with heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 於是濟北王以為天子且封禪，乃上書獻泰山及其旁邑。

translations.literal: Thereupon King of Jibei thought Son of Heaven about to perform Feng Shan, submitted memorial offered Mount Tai and neighboring towns.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the King of Jibei thought the Son of Heaven was about to perform the Feng and Shan sacrifices, and submitted a memorial offering Mount Tai and its neighboring towns.

sentences.zh: 天子受之，更以他縣償之。

translations.literal: Son of Heaven accepted it, moreover compensated with other counties.
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven accepted it and moreover compensated him with other counties.

sentences.zh: 常山王有罪，遷，天子封其弟於真定，以續先王祀，而以常山為郡。

translations.literal: King of Changshan committed crime, moved, Son of Heaven enfeoffed his younger brother at Zhending, to continue previous king's sacrifices, made Changshan commandery.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Changshan committed a crime and was moved. The Son of Heaven enfeoffed his younger brother at Zhending to continue the previous king's sacrifices, and made Changshan a commandery.

sentences.zh: 然後五嶽皆在天子之郡。

translations.literal: Then Five Sacred Peaks all in Son of Heaven's commanderies.
translations.idiomatic: Then all the Five Sacred Peaks were within the Son of Heaven's commanderies.

translations.literal: Thereupon the King of Jibei considered that the Son of Heaven was about to perform the fengshan ceremony, so he memorialized and offered Taishan and its neighboring cities. The Son of Heaven accepted it, and moreover compensated him with other counties. The King of Changshan had a crime and was banished. The Son of Heaven enfeoffed his younger brother at Zhending to continue the previous king's sacrifices, and made Changshan into a commandery. Then all five peaks were in the Son of Heaven's commanderies.

sentences.zh: 其明年，齊人少翁以鬼神方見上。

translations.literal: The next year, the Qi man Shaojun appeared before the emperor with methods for ghosts and spirits.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, Shaojun of Qi appeared before the emperor with his methods for summoning ghosts and spirits.

sentences.zh: 上有所幸王夫人，夫人卒，少翁以方術蓋夜致王夫人及灶鬼之貌云，天子自帷中望見焉。

translations.literal: The emperor favored Lady Wang, the lady died, Shaojun used his arts secretly at night to summon Lady Wang and a stove ghost's appearance, it is said, and the Son of Heaven saw them from within his curtains.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor had favored Lady Wang, but she had passed away. Shaojun used his occult arts to secretly summon the apparitions of Lady Wang and a stove spirit by night, and it is said that the emperor beheld them from behind his curtains.

sentences.zh: 於是乃拜少翁為文成將軍，賞賜甚多，以客禮禮之。

translations.literal: Thereupon he appointed Shaojun as General Wencheng, bestowed very many rewards, and treated him with guest rituals.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the emperor appointed Shaojun as General Wencheng, lavished many rewards upon him, and treated him with the courtesy due a distinguished guest.

sentences.zh: 文成言曰：「上即欲與神通，宮室被服不象神，神物不至。」

translations.literal: Wencheng said: "If the emperor wishes to communicate with spirits, the palace chambers and clothing do not resemble those of gods, divine things will not come."
translations.idiomatic: Wencheng said, "If Your Majesty wishes to commune with the spirits, the palace chambers and garments do not resemble those of the gods, and so divine beings will not appear."

sentences.zh: 乃作畫雲氣車，及各以勝日駕車辟惡鬼。

translations.literal: He had painted chariots made depicting cloud vapors, and each used auspicious days to drive chariots and ward off evil spirits.
translations.idiomatic: He commissioned chariots painted with clouds and vapors, and each was driven on an auspicious day to ward off evil spirits.

sentences.zh: 又作甘泉宮，中為臺室，畫天、地、泰一諸神，而置祭具以致天神。

translations.literal: He also built Ganquan Palace, in the center made terrace chambers, painted the various gods of Heaven, Earth, and Taiyi, and placed sacrificial implements to summon heavenly gods.
translations.idiomatic: He also constructed Ganquan Palace, with terrace chambers at its center painted with the various deities of Heaven, Earth, and Taiyi, and furnished with sacrificial vessels to summon the celestial gods.

sentences.zh: 居歲餘，其方益衰，神不至。

translations.literal: After residing there over a year, his methods increasingly declined, and spirits did not come.
translations.idiomatic: After residing there for more than a year, his methods grew increasingly ineffective, and the spirits failed to appear.

sentences.zh: 乃為帛書以飯牛，詳弗知也，言此牛腹中有奇。

translations.literal: He made a silk book to feed to an ox, pretended not to know, and said that there was something strange in this ox's belly.
translations.idiomatic: He prepared a book written on silk and fed it to an ox, pretending ignorance of the matter, and claimed that something wondrous was hidden within the ox's belly.

sentences.zh: 殺而視之，得書，書言其怪，天子疑之。

translations.literal: They killed and examined it, obtained the book, the book spoke of its strangeness, and the Son of Heaven doubted it.
translations.idiomatic: The ox was slaughtered and examined, the book was retrieved, and when it spoke of portents, the emperor grew suspicious.

sentences.zh: 有識其手書，問之人，果（為）［偽］書。

translations.literal: Someone recognized his handwriting, questioned the person, and indeed it was a forged book.
translations.idiomatic: Someone recognized the handwriting, questioned the man involved, and indeed it proved to be a forged document.

sentences.zh: 於是誅文成將軍而隱之。

translations.literal: Thereupon they executed General Wencheng but concealed it.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon General Wencheng was executed, but the matter was kept secret.

translations.literal: The next year, the Qi person Shao Weng appeared before the emperor with ghost and spirit methods. The emperor had favored Lady Wang. The lady had died. Shao Weng with his method arts overnight brought the appearance of Lady Wang and the stove ghost, it is said. The Son of Heaven gazed and saw them from within the curtain. Thereupon then appointed Shao Weng as Wencheng general, rewards very many, treated him with guest ritual. Wencheng spoke said: 'Emperor immediately wants to connect with spirits, palaces and clothing do not resemble spirits, spirit things will not arrive.' Then made painted cloud qi carriage, and each with victory day drove carriage to ward off evil ghosts. Again made Ganquan palace, middle made platform rooms, painted heaven, earth, Taiyi and various spirits, yet placed sacrifice implements to bring heaven spirits. Stayed more than a year, their methods increasingly declined, spirits did not arrive. He then made a silk book and fed it to the ox, pretending not to know, saying that this ox's belly had a marvel. They killed and inspected it, obtained the book, the book spoke of its marvel. The Son of Heaven doubted it. Someone recognized his handwriting and asked people about it. Indeed it was a false book. Thereupon he executed the General of Wencheng but concealed it.

sentences.zh: 其後則又作柏梁、銅柱、承露僊人掌之屬矣。

translations.literal: Afterwards they also made the Cypress Beam, Bronze Pillar, and figures of immortals holding dew-catching palms and the like.
translations.idiomatic: Afterwards, the Cypress Beam, Bronze Pillar, and figures of immortals holding dew-catching palms were also constructed.

translations.literal: Afterward, he then moreover made the Cypress Beam, Copper Pillar, Dew Receiving Immortal Person, and palm and such things.

sentences.zh: 文成死明年，天子病鼎湖甚，巫醫無所不致，（至）不愈。

translations.literal: The year after Wencheng died, the Son of Heaven fell gravely ill at Dinghu, and witches and physicians were employed without limit, but he did not recover.
translations.idiomatic: The year after Wencheng's death, the emperor fell gravely ill at Dinghu Lake. Witches and physicians were summoned without restraint, yet he did not recover.

sentences.zh: 游水發根乃言曰：「上郡有巫，病而鬼下之。」

translations.literal: You Shui Fagen then said: "There is a witch in Shangjun who, when ill, has spirits descend upon her."
translations.idiomatic: You Shui Fagen then said, "There is a shamaness in Shangjun who, when she falls ill, has spirits descend upon her."

sentences.zh: 上召置祠之甘泉。

translations.literal: The emperor summoned her and established a shrine for her at Ganquan.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor summoned her and established a shrine in her honor at Ganquan Palace.

sentences.zh: 及病，使人問神君。

translations.literal: When he became ill, he sent people to ask the Divine Lord.
translations.idiomatic: When he fell ill, he sent messengers to consult the Divine Lord.

sentences.zh: 神君言曰：「天子毋憂病。

translations.literal: The Divine Lord said: "Son of Heaven, need not worry about illness.
translations.idiomatic: The Divine Lord replied, "Your Majesty need not worry about your illness.

sentences.zh: 病少愈，彊與我會甘泉。」

translations.literal: When illness slightly improves, force yourself to meet with me at Ganquan."
translations.idiomatic: When your illness improves slightly, make yourself come meet with me at Ganquan Palace."

sentences.zh: 於是病愈，遂幸甘泉，病良已。

translations.literal: Thereupon the illness was cured, consequently visited Ganquan, illness truly gone.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he recovered from his illness and proceeded to visit Ganquan Palace, where his sickness was completely cured.

sentences.zh: 大赦天下，置壽宮神君。

translations.literal: Granted great amnesty to all under Heaven, established Shou Palace for the Divine Lord.
translations.idiomatic: He granted a general amnesty throughout the empire and established the Shou Palace in honor of the Divine Lord.

sentences.zh: 神君最貴者（大夫）［太一］，其佐曰大禁、司命之屬，皆從之。

translations.literal: The Divine Lord most honored was Taiyi, his assistants were called Great Prohibition, Director of Fate and the like, all followed him.
translations.idiomatic: The most honored among the divine lords was Taiyi, with assistants called Great Prohibition, Director of Fate, and others of that kind, all of whom attended him.

sentences.zh: 非可得見，聞其音，與人言等。

translations.literal: He could not be seen, but one could hear his voice, which was equal to human speech.
translations.idiomatic: He could not be seen, but his voice could be heard, sounding just like human speech.

sentences.zh: 時去時來，來則風肅然也。

translations.literal: Sometimes he left, sometimes he came; when he came, the wind was solemn.
translations.idiomatic: He came and went at times; when he arrived, a solemn wind accompanied him.

sentences.zh: 居室帷中。

translations.literal: He dwelt within the chamber curtains.
translations.idiomatic: He resided within the curtained chamber.

sentences.zh: 時晝言，然常以夜。

translations.literal: Sometimes he spoke during the daytime, but usually at night.
translations.idiomatic: He sometimes spoke during the day, but more often at night.

sentences.zh: 天子祓，然後入。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven purified himself, then entered.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor performed purification rites before entering.

sentences.zh: 因巫為主人，關飲食。

translations.literal: He relied on the shamaness as host, who oversaw food and drink.
translations.idiomatic: He relied on the shamaness to serve as hostess and oversee the serving of food and drink.

sentences.zh: 所欲者言行下。

translations.literal: Whatever was desired was spoken and carried out.
translations.idiomatic: Whatever was desired would be spoken of and then carried out.

sentences.zh: 又置壽宮、北宮，張羽旗，設供具，以禮神君。

translations.literal: He also established the Shou Palace and North Palace, spread feather banners, set up sacrificial implements, to honor the Divine Lord.
translations.idiomatic: He also established the Shou Palace and North Palace, unfurled feathered banners, and arranged sacrificial vessels to honor the Divine Lord.

sentences.zh: 神君所言，上使人受書其言，命之曰「畫法」。

translations.literal: What the Divine Lord said, the emperor had people receive and write down her words, naming it "Portrait Methods."
translations.idiomatic: Whatever the Divine Lord said, the emperor had scribes record her words and named the collection "Portrait Methods."

sentences.zh: 其所語，世俗之所知也，毋絕殊者，而天子獨喜。

translations.literal: What she spoke of was what the common world knew, nothing extraordinarily different, yet the Son of Heaven alone was pleased.
translations.idiomatic: What she spoke of was common knowledge to ordinary people, nothing extraordinary at all, yet the emperor alone took delight in it.

sentences.zh: 其事祕，世莫知也。

translations.literal: Her affairs were secret, and the world did not know of them.
translations.idiomatic: Her affairs remained secret, unknown to the world.

You Shui Fagen then spoke and said: 'The Shang commandery has a witch. He was ill but a spirit descended upon him.' The emperor summoned and placed sacrifice at Ganquan. And when illness came, sent people to ask the spirit lord. The spirit lord spoke said: 'Son of Heaven, do not worry about illness. Illness slightly better, strong meet me at Ganquan.' Thereupon illness healed, then favored Ganquan, illness truly gone. He granted a great amnesty to the realm and established the Shou Palace for the divine lord. The divine lord's most noble was Taiyi. His assistants were called Great Prohibition, Controller of Fate, and such kinds. All followed him. He could not be seen, but his sound could be heard, equal to a person's speech. Sometimes he departed, sometimes he came. When he came, then the wind was solemn and calm. He resided in the room within the curtain. Sometimes he spoke in the daytime, but usually at night. The Son of Heaven performed purification, then entered. He used the witch as host, concerned with food and drink. What he desired, he spoke and it then descended. He moreover established the Shou Palace and North Palace, spread feather flags, set up offerings and utensils, to ritualize the divine lord. What the divine lord spoke, the emperor had someone receive and write down his words, naming it the 'painting method'. What he spoke of was what the world's customs knew, nothing extremely exceptional, yet the Son of Heaven alone was happy. His matters were secret; the world knew none of them.

sentences.zh: 其後三年，有司言元宜以天瑞命，不宜以一二數。

translations.literal: Three years later, the officials said eras should be named according to heavenly auspicious signs, not according to numbering with one and two.
translations.idiomatic: Three years later, the officials declared that eras should be named according to heavenly portents rather than numbered sequentially.

sentences.zh: 一元曰建元，二元以長星曰元光，三元以郊得一角獸曰元狩云。

translations.literal: The first era was called Jianyuan, the second era with a comet was called Yuanguang, the third era with a unicorn obtained during suburban sacrifices was called Yuanshou, it is said.
translations.idiomatic: The first era was named Jianyuan, the second era Yuanguang after the appearance of a comet, and the third era Yuanshou after a unicorn was captured during the suburban sacrifices.

translations.literal: Three years later, the officials said that 'yuan' should be named with heaven's auspicious signs, not suitable to use the numbers one and two. The first yuan was called Jian Yuan, the second yuan with a long star was called Yuan Guang, the third yuan with a suburban one-horned beast obtained was called Yuan Shou, it is said.

sentences.zh: 其明年冬，天子郊雍，議曰：「今上帝朕親郊，而後土毋祀，則禮不答也。」

translations.literal: The next year in winter, the Son of Heaven performed suburban sacrifices at Yong and discussed: "Now I personally perform suburban sacrifices to the Supreme Deity, but Houtu has no sacrifices, so the ritual is not reciprocal."
translations.idiomatic: The following winter, the emperor performed suburban sacrifices at Yong and remarked, "I personally offer suburban sacrifices to the Supreme Deity, but Houtu receives none. This makes the ritual incomplete."

sentences.zh: 有司與太史公、祠官寬舒等議：「天地牲角繭栗。

translations.literal: The officials, together with the Grand Historian and sacrificial official Kuanshu and others, discussed: "The sacrificial animals for Heaven and Earth should have horns like silkworm cocoons.
translations.idiomatic: The officials, along with the Grand Historian and sacrificial official Kuanshu and others, deliberated: "The horns of sacrificial animals for Heaven and Earth should resemble silkworm cocoons.

sentences.zh: 今陛下親祀后土，后土宜於澤中圜丘為五壇，壇一黃犢太牢具，已祠盡瘞，而從祠衣上黃。」

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty personally sacrifices to Houtu. Houtu should have five altars built on a round mound in the marsh, each altar with one yellow calf and full sacrificial animals. After the sacrifice, everything should be completely buried, and the attendants' clothing should all be yellow."
translations.idiomatic: Now that Your Majesty personally sacrifices to Houtu, five altars should be constructed for her on a round mound in the marsh, each with a yellow calf and complete sacrificial offerings. After the ceremony, all should be buried, and the attendants should wear yellow robes."

sentences.zh: 於是天子遂東，始立后土祠汾陰脽上，如寬舒等議。

translations.literal: Thereupon the Son of Heaven went east and first established a Houtu shrine on the slope at Fen River Yin, as Kuanshu and others had proposed.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the emperor journeyed east and established the first shrine to Houtu on the slope at Fenyin, following the proposals of Kuanshu and his colleagues.

sentences.zh: 上親望拜，如上帝禮。

translations.literal: The emperor personally gazed and bowed, following the ritual for the Supreme Deity.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor personally gazed upon the shrine and performed the bows, following the same ritual as for the Supreme Deity.

sentences.zh: 禮畢，天子遂至滎陽而還。

translations.literal: When the ritual was completed, the Son of Heaven then went to Xingyang and returned.
translations.idiomatic: Upon completion of the ritual, the emperor proceeded to Xingyang before returning.

sentences.zh: 過雒陽，下詔曰：「三代邈絕，遠矣難存。

translations.literal: Passing through Luoyang, he issued an edict saying: "The Three Dynasties are distant and remote, far gone and hard to preserve.
translations.idiomatic: Passing through Luoyang, he issued an edict stating, "The Three Dynasties lie in distant antiquity, too remote to preserve intact.

sentences.zh: 其以三十里地封周後為周子南君，以奉先王祀焉。」

translations.literal: Grant thirty li of land to enfeoff the Zhou descendant as Lord Zhouzi Nan, to maintain the sacrifices to the former kings."
translations.idiomatic: Grant thirty li of land to enfeoff a descendant of Zhou as Lord Zhouzi Nan, to maintain the sacrifices to the former kings."

sentences.zh: 是歲，天子始巡郡縣，侵尋於泰山矣。

translations.literal: This year, the Son of Heaven began touring the commanderies and counties, gradually approaching Mount Tai.
translations.idiomatic: That year, the emperor began his tours of the commanderies and counties, gradually making his way toward Mount Tai.

translations.literal: The next year in winter, the Son of Heaven performed suburban sacrifices at Yong and discussed, saying: 'Now I personally perform suburban sacrifices to the Supreme Deity, yet Houtu has no sacrifices, then the ritual is not reciprocal.' Now Your Majesty personally sacrifices to Houtu. Houtu should have five altars made in a round mound in the marsh, each altar with one yellow calf and complete great sacrificial animals. After sacrificing, all are buried, and following the sacrifice, the clothing is upper yellow.' Thereupon the Son of Heaven then east, began establish Houtu sacrifice on Fenyin wei above, like Kuanshu etc discussed. The emperor personally gazed and bowed, like Supreme Deity ritual. Ritual completed, the Son of Heaven then arrived at Xingyang and returned. Passed Luoyang, issued edict said: 'Three dynasties distant and broken, far, difficult to preserve. With thirty li of land, enfeoff the Zhou descendants as Lord Zi Nan of Zhou, to conduct the previous kings' sacrifices there.' This year, the Son of Heaven began touring the commanderies and counties, gradually approaching Taishan.

sentences.zh: 其春，樂成侯上書言欒大。

translations.literal: That spring, the Marquis of Lecheng submitted a memorial speaking of Luan Da.
translations.idiomatic: That spring, the Marquis of Lecheng submitted a memorial recommending Luan Da.

sentences.zh: 欒大，膠東宮人，故嘗與文成將軍同師，已而為膠東王尚方。

translations.literal: Luan Da was a palace attendant from Jiaodong. He had formerly studied with General Wencheng, and afterwards became the Jiaodong King's Director of Manufactories.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Da was a palace attendant from Jiaodong. He had once studied under General Wencheng, and later became Director of Manufactories for the King of Jiaodong.

sentences.zh: 而樂成侯姊為康王后，毋子。

translations.literal: And the Marquis of Lecheng's sister was King Kang's queen, but had no children.
translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Lecheng's sister was Queen to King Kang, but bore him no children.

sentences.zh: 康王死，他姬子立為王。

translations.literal: King Kang died, and a son by another concubine was established as king.
translations.idiomatic: When King Kang died, a son by another consort was enthroned as king.

sentences.zh: 而康后有淫行，與王不相中（得），相危以法。

translations.literal: But Queen Kang had licentious behavior and did not get along with the king; they threatened each other with legal action.
translations.idiomatic: But Queen Kang engaged in licentious conduct and quarreled constantly with the king, each threatening the other with legal prosecution.

sentences.zh: 康后聞文成已死，而欲自媚於上，乃遣欒大因樂成侯求見言方。

translations.literal: Queen Kang heard that Wencheng had already died, and wished to curry favor with the emperor, so she sent Luan Da through the Marquis of Lecheng to seek an audience and speak of recipes.
translations.idiomatic: Queen Kang learned that Wencheng had died and sought to ingratiate herself with the emperor by sending Luan Da through the Marquis of Lecheng to request an audience and discuss his methods.

sentences.zh: 天子既誅文成，後悔恨其早死，惜其方不盡，及見欒大，大悅。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven, having executed Wencheng, afterwards regretted and resented his early death, grieved that his recipes were not complete, and when he saw Luan Da, was greatly pleased.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor, having executed Wencheng, later regretted it bitterly and grieved that his methods remained incomplete. When he met Luan Da, he was greatly delighted.

sentences.zh: 大為人長美，言多方略，而敢為大言，處之不疑。

translations.literal: Da was a tall and handsome person, spoke of many strategies, dared to make grand claims, and handled matters without doubt.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Da was a tall and handsome man who spoke of many ingenious schemes, dared to make extravagant claims, and carried himself with complete confidence.

sentences.zh: 大言曰：「臣嘗往來海中，見安期、羨門之屬。

translations.literal: Da said: "I once traveled back and forth in the sea and saw An Qi, Xianmen and their kind.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Da said, "I once journeyed across the seas and encountered immortals like An Qi and Xianmen.

sentences.zh: 顧以為臣賤，不信臣。

translations.literal: They looked back, thinking I was lowly, and did not believe me.
translations.idiomatic: They regarded me as baseborn and refused to believe my words.

sentences.zh: 又以為康王諸侯耳，不足予方。

translations.literal: They also thought King Kang was only a feudal lord, not worth giving recipes to.
translations.idiomatic: They also considered King Kang merely a vassal lord, unworthy of receiving such teachings.

sentences.zh: 臣數言康王，康王又不用臣。

translations.literal: I frequently spoke to King Kang, but King Kang moreover did not use me.
translations.idiomatic: I spoke repeatedly to King Kang, but he would not employ my services.

sentences.zh: 臣之師曰：『黃金可成，而河決可塞，不死之藥可得，僊人可致也。』

translations.literal: My teacher said: 'Gold can be created, breached rivers can be blocked, immortality medicine can be obtained, and immortals can be summoned.'
translations.idiomatic: My master declared, 'Gold can be transmuted, breached rivers can be repaired, the elixir of immortality can be obtained, and immortals can be summoned.'

sentences.zh: 臣恐效文成，則方士皆掩口，惡敢言方哉！」

translations.literal: I fear imitating Wencheng, then all alchemists will cover their mouths - how would they dare speak of recipes!
translations.idiomatic: I fear suffering Wencheng's fate, for then all the alchemists would fall silent—who would dare speak of such arts!"

sentences.zh: 上曰：「文成食馬肝死耳。

translations.literal: The emperor said: "Wencheng only died from eating horse liver.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor replied, "Wencheng died merely from eating horse liver.

sentences.zh: 子誠能修其方，我何愛乎！」

translations.literal: If you can truly perfect his recipes, what would I begrudge!
translations.idiomatic: If you can truly complete his methods, what would I withhold from you!"

sentences.zh: 大曰：「臣師非有求人，人者求之。

translations.literal: Da said: "My teacher does not seek people; people seek him.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Da said, "My master does not seek out disciples; rather, the disciples must seek him out.

sentences.zh: 陛下必欲致之，則貴其使者，令有親屬，以客禮待之，勿卑，使各佩其信印，乃可使通言於神人。

translations.literal: Your Majesty must desire to summon them, then honor their envoys, make them have relatives, treat with guest rituals, do not demean, make each wear their trust seals, then can make communicate with divine people.
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty truly wishes to summon them, then honor their envoys, provide them with families, treat them as honored guests, never demean them, and have each wear seals of authority. Only then can they communicate with the divine beings.

sentences.zh: 神人尚肯邪不邪。

translations.literal: Divine people still willing or not.
translations.idiomatic: Will the divine beings still be willing?

sentences.zh: 致尊其使，然後可致也。」

translations.literal: Treat their envoys with honor, then can summon."
translations.idiomatic: Honor their envoys properly, and only then can they be summoned."

sentences.zh: 於是上使先驗小方，鬬旗，旗自相觸擊。

translations.literal: Thereupon the emperor made first verify small recipes, fighting banners, banners spontaneously struck each other.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the emperor first tested some minor recipes, and the fighting banners spontaneously struck each other.
